text: The <extra_id_0> v-erbA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> oncoprotein represents a retrovirus - transduced oncogenic version of the thyroid hormone ( T3 / T4 ) receptor <extra_id_0> c-erbA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( type alpha ) .
It contributes to virus - induced erythroleukemia by efficiently arresting differentiation of red cell progenitors and by suppressing transcription of erythrocyte - specific genes .

Here , we show that <extra_id_0> v-erbA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-erbA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> bind directly to sequences within the promoter of the erythrocyte - specific <extra_id_0> carbonic anhydrase II <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CAII <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a gene whose transcription is efficiently suppressed by <extra_id_0> v-erbA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
